Data: Toss: West Indies have won the toss and they will bat first. They have made three changes. Santokie, Bonner and Darren Bravo make way for Samuels, Fidel Edwards and Danza Hyatt.
Pattinson to Smith, 5 wide terrific start by Pattinson, slips it really wide down the leg side, he would have needed three keepers to stop that
Pattinson to Smith, no run big inside edge and the ball rolls to the on side
Pattinson to Smith, no run goes back at the crease and knocks it to the on side
Pattinson to Smith, no run hits a good length on the off stump and he knocks it down to mid-off
Pattinson to Smith, FOUR runs that's a lovely flick, full delivery on the pads and he works his wrists and finds the big gap at midwicket
Pattinson to Smith, 1 run whacks it across the line and he finds fine leg, he wanted to hit more in front of square
Pattinson to Charles, FOUR runs Charles clears his front leg and clubs a length ball wide of square leg, big gap on the on side
Lee to Smith, no run gets forward and punches it hard but straight to mid-off
Lee to Smith, FOUR runs gives him a bit of width and Smith stands tall and thrashes it wide of point, sent the ball scorching to the boundary
Lee to Smith, 1 run tucks it towards mid-on and they pinch a single
Lee to Charles, SIX runs Charles has faced only two balls and he already has ten! He makes room early, bends his knee to a full delivery and slices it high and long over deep backward point
Lee to Charles, FOUR runs just boundaries for Charles! Full delivery on the pads and he whips him away down to deep square leg
Lee to Charles, no run a touch wide outside the off stump and he slashes and misses
McKay to Smith, no run on target, length ball on the stumps and defended
McKay to Smith, 1 run punches it just past the bowler and they take a quick single
McKay to Charles, 1 run slower delivery and he adjusted his shot by angling it just wide of short third man
McKay to Smith, 1 run uses his wrists to whip a full delivery down to long-on, the fielder was pushed back
McKay to Charles, no run foxes him with a slower one, he was down the track and McKay did well to adjust his pace, swing and a miss
McKay to Charles, 2 runs full outside off and he drives square, wide of point
Doherty to Smith, 1 run pushes it quicker on the pads and he works it down to midwicket
Doherty to Charles, 1 run swept but just to the right of short fine leg
Doherty to Smith, no run fires it flat and quick and he runs it down to short third man and Smith sends Charles back
Doherty to Smith, 1 run swept but can't beat short fine leg
Doherty to Charles, 1 run he chips down the track and swings just over the reach of mid-on who leaps sideways, but long-on's there to cut it off
Doherty to Smith, no run opens the face and steers it down to short third man
McKay to Charles, FOUR runs premeditated from Charles as he walks across his stumps, fetches the ball from the off stump and swings him to deep square leg
McKay to Charles, 1 wide attempted slower delivery but sprays it wide outside off
McKay to Charles, no run slower ball and Charles tries to slog but misses, the batsman isn't pleased with himself
McKay to Charles, no run another slower ball and he chops it down to cover point
McKay to Charles, FOUR runs streaky! Charles clears the front leg to slog a full toss but gets an inside edge that trickles past the stumps and beats short fine leg
McKay to Charles, no run pushes a slower ball to point and Charles thinks of a single
McKay to Charles, no run slogs at another slower ball wide outside off but misses
Doherty to Smith, FOUR runs effortless drive! Full delivery outside off and he gets his body behind it and drives wide of cover
Doherty to Smith, 1 run tucks it firmly down to deep square leg
Doherty to Charles, FOUR runs Charles will be pleased he middled that better, on his knee and he swings and finds the gap at deep midwicket
Doherty to Charles, 1 run goes back and slaps him down to long-off
Doherty to Smith, FOUR runs Doherty drops it a fraction short again and he rocks back and thumps it between cover and extra cover
Doherty to Smith, FOUR runs he makes the error by dropping short again, Smith rocks back and pounds it over midwicket
Watson to Charles, 1 run full on the off stump and driven down to long-off
Watson to Smith, 1 leg bye slower delivery hits him on the pads but down the leg side, Watson appeals
Watson to Charles, (no ball) FOUR runs high full toss turns into a beamer! Charles somehow manages to bend down and still slam it down to fine leg, Watson apologies immediately
Watson to Charles, no run drives a full delivery straight to extra cover
Watson to Charles, OUT Charles tries to go downtown over the sight screen, makes room and it looked like there was a change of pace, couldn't clear long-off, Christian takes the catch
Watson to Smith, 2 runs gets across and clips it towards midwicket and they do well to take the second run
Watson to Smith, 2 runs good running again, Smith clips it wide of long-on and pushes Pollard for the second, puts pressure on the fielders
Lee to Pollard, no run pacy delivery short and wide outside off and he decides to leave it alone
Lee to Pollard, 1 run Lee aims for the body and he has Pollard weaving away from this short delivery and fending it off to the off side
Lee to Smith, no run full on the off stump and driven firmly down to mid-off
Lee to Smith, 2 runs good length on the stumps and he whips it away down to fine leg and ensures he takes a second
Lee to Smith, 1 run hammers a half volley down to long-off but the fielder from long-on mops up

Lee to Pollard, OUT that's a massive wicket for Australia, Lee continues to keep it a bit short of a length and Pollard is cramped for room outside off, tries to dab it to third man but gets a faint outside edge to the keeper

Pattinson to Smith, SIX runs that landed on the second tier! Can we have the ball back please? Picks a length delivery from the off stump and in one motion sends the ball soaring over wide long-on, tremendous bat speed
Pattinson to Smith, 1 wide attempted yorker but wide down the leg side, fast yorker though
Pattinson to Smith, no run tries to run it to the on side, the ball skids through
Pattinson to Smith, SIX runs speed of light! Smith picks another length delivery and carts it over wide long-on, didn't seem to put much effort but he sent that over the Sobers pavilion
Pattinson to Smith, SIX runs wow! This was more exquisite, pitched up on middle and off and Smith merely lofts him over long-on, great balance and poise and that's his first T20 fifty
Pattinson to Smith, 1 run full on the pads and he clips it to the leg side
Pattinson to Bravo, no run stays on the back foot and defends
Doherty to Smith, FOUR runs slides down the leg side and he's punished for that, on his knee and sweeps wide of short fine leg
Doherty to Smith, SIX runs Smith has some lucrative deal with that on-side! Flighted and he gets on his knee and smacks it over deep midwicket
Doherty to Smith, no run comes over the wicket and he fires it full, keeps him quiet
Doherty to Smith, OUT Smith goes for another big hit, he made room and tries to loft him over the sight-screen but turned the face of the bat and couldn
Doherty to Bravo, no run gets well forward and defends to the off side
Doherty to Bravo, no run jams out a full delivery back to the bowler
Christian to Sammy, 1 run gets well forward and drives a full delivery down to long-off
Christian to Bravo, 1 run clips it towards long-on and there's a misfield by Watson in the in field
Christian to Sammy, 1 run full outside the off stump and Pattinson does well to stop it at point
Christian to Bravo, no run full and swinging in and he jams it back to the bowler
Christian to Bravo, 1 run full outside off and he shapes to punch it straight but gets an outside edge to third man
Christian to Sammy, 1 run full and wide outside off and he to Lee at sweeper cover
Watson to Sammy, no run Watson keeps it tight, tucks him up for room and Sammy can only push it back to the bowler
Watson to Sammy, 1 wide slides down the leg side and wide called
Watson to Sammy, no run drives to the off side very close to his pads and Watson thought it was pad first and appealed
Watson to Sammy, no run tries to shovel a full delivery to the on side but can't beat midwicket
Watson to Sammy, 1 run gets across and clips him to the on side
Watson to Bravo, 1 run opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
Watson to Sammy, 1 wide misdirects the slower ball down the leg side
Watson to Sammy, 1 run ends the over with a venomous yorker down the leg side and Sammy nearly lost his balance at the crease as he tried to dig it out

McKay to Sammy, OUT soft dismissal for Sammy, McKay bowls the slower one outside off, Sammy was at the crease trying to swing it away over the on side but ended up getting an inside edge that pegged back the middle stump
McKay to Hyatt, no run steers it to the off side, can't beat point
McKay to Hyatt, 1 run close call for Hyatt as he chipped a slower delivery over the on side but safe of long-on
McKay to Bravo, no run Bravo was foxed by the slower one that was pitched a bit short and bounced a bit more than expected
McKay to Bravo, 2 runs clipped wide of midwicket and they push for the second run, good running
McKay to Bravo, 1 run gets across and pushes a full delivery down to long-off
Christian to Bravo, 2 runs clips a full toss down to long-on and they take the first run quickly, good running again

Christian to Bravo, 3 runs Direct hit and the Australians look confident! It was clipped to wide long-on and Hyatt had to rush that second run, he managed to ground his bat just before the direct hit, I'm not sure who the thrower was, decision referred and he's safe, they took an extra run following the deflection
Christian to Hyatt, no run gets across and defends back to the bowler
Christian to Hyatt, no run
Christian to Hyatt, FOUR runs an attempted yorker becomes a low full toss and Hyatt cracks that wide of extra cover. had to punish that
Christian to Hyatt, 1 run clips a full delivery to the on side to retain strike

McKay to Hyatt, OUT the captain sets a good example! Hyatt doesn't pick a slower ball bowled from the back of the hand, makes room and sends the ball skywards, it swirls in the air for a long time and Bailey cupped it in the region of mid-off and went tumbling back
McKay to Bravo, 2 runs full and swinging in on the pads and he whips it behind square on the on side
McKay to Bravo, 1 run drives off the front foot and just beats Bailey, long-off picks up
McKay to Samuels, 1 run full outside off and jammed to the off side
McKay to Bravo, 1 run bowls it full again and he pushes it down to long-off
McKay to Samuels, 1 run slower ball and he reaches out a chops it towards point

Christian to Samuels, OUT West Indies losing the plot fast! Samuels makes a bit of room to a full delivery and mistimes the loft over the off side, the bat face turned and the ball was skied to Warner at wide long-off
Christian to Bravo, 1 run tucks it down to deep midwicket
Christian to Baugh, 1 run clips it with soft hands towards midwicket and takes a quick single
Christian to Bravo, 2 runs clips a full delivery wide of long-on and there was some hesitation for the second, Christian fumbled as the fielder hurled it to him and Baugh was in trouble
Christian to Bravo, 1 run takes a single down to deep midwicket
Christian to Baugh, no run nudges it down to short midwicket
Watson to Bravo, 1 run opens the face of the bat and dabs it down to third man
Watson to Baugh, no run makes room to slash outside the off stump and misses
Watson to Baugh, FOUR runs should come as a relief to West Indies, Baugh gets on his knee and plays a forceful square drive past point and Lee had it covered near the rope but he too fumbled
Watson to Baugh, no run fails to dig out a yorker outside off
Watson to Baugh, 1 run slower ball on the pads and clipped to fine leg
Watson to Bravo, 1 run full on the pads and clipped down to long-on
Lee to Bravo, no run Bravo whips it straight to midwicket and Baugh was halfway down the pitch before he turned back, he had given up but the throw to the stumps was wide
Lee to Bravo, 1 run slower delivery and he clips it down to midwicket
Lee to Baugh, no run
Lee to Baugh, 1 run squirts out a fast yorker outside off to the off side
Lee to Bravo, 1 run drives straight to extra cover and goes through with the single
Lee to Baugh, OUT Baugh backs away to smash that over the off side but gets a thick outside edge to the keeper, quite a soft dismissal, Lee pitched the ball up a bit
Watson to Bravo, OUT another wheel comes off, makes room to a length delivery and swings across the line, didn't get the timing or the elevation and finds Christian at long-on
Watson to Mathurin, no run lands outside the off stump and nearly gets a thin edge
Watson to Mathurin, 1 run gets across and punches it down to long-off
Watson to Narine, 1 run spoons it towards mid-off, not sure what he was trying
Watson to Mathurin, 1 run fetches it from outside off and swings it down to deep midwicket
Watson to Narine, 1 run goes back at the crease and slaps it to sweeper cover
Lee to Narine, no run Narine didn't see that slower one, it was pitched short and he uneasily weaved away from it

Lee to Narine, OUT jams out a full delivery towards the right of mid-off and risk the single, there' s a direct hit by Bailey and Narine is yards short, looked obvious at first glance but the third umpire had a look
Lee to Mathurin, 1 run squeezes out a yorker towards the off side again and Bailey nearly effected another direct hit
Lee to Edwards, OUT West Indies fail to bat out the overs! Lee fires in an inswinging yorker on middle stump, too good for Edwards who makes room and misses, the bails are all over the place
Alan Gardner, fresh from the Wanderer's washout, will take you through the rest of the game Join us soon.

Quite an anti-climax for West Indies, considering the start. They completely lost the plot especially after they lost Smith and Australia did really well to pull things back. What West Indies can learn from their opponents is the use of the slower ball. There were plenty of them. McKay especially choked the batsmen with it.
Edwards to Warner, no run full, on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
Edwards to Warner, no run almost yorker length from Edwards, swinging a touch into Warner, who gets a thin inside edge on to hid pad, which saves him from an lbw decision
Edwards to Warner, no run length ball, on the stumps, played to cover
Edwards to Warner, 1 run pitched up and Warner swings his arms through it, smashing it on the half-volley past extra-cover ... no, wait, a superb diving stop keeps the damage to one
Edwards to Watson, no run pacy delivery, in the corridor, Watson swishes and misses
Narine to Warner, no run tossed up outside off, played out towards cover
Narine to Warner, no run on the stumps, defended coming forward
Narine to Warner, no run shorter delivery, on the legs and Warner pulls but finds the man at short backward square
Narine to Warner, 1 run flighted, dipping outside off, driven past point, who makes the stop but can't hold on to the ball
Narine to Bailey, 1 run flatter, on the stumps, whipped to leg where a diving Fidel Edwards half fields
Narine to Warner, no run length, blocked towards mid-off from in front of the stumps

Edwards to Bailey, 1 run bouncer, Bailey hooks ... dropped him! It flew hard and flat to Johnson Charles at long leg, he positioned himself to take it but it popped out of his grasp as he went with fingers up. Oh, Johnson!
Edwards to Warner, FOUR runs pitched up across the left-hander, wide of off stump, and shovelled over the infield for the first boundary of the innings
Edwards to Warner, no run around the wicket, holds a line wide of off, Warner goes down on one knee to slog but gets nothing on it
Edwards to Warner, no run straight through him this time! Speared, fast and bouncy, Warner swings across the line and the ball whistles just past the stumps
Edwards to Warner, FOUR runs bouncer, leaping up towards the throat, Warner rocks on his heels and guides an uppercut over point to the square boundary. Have at you!
Edwards to Warner, no run length ball this time, on the stumps and driven to mid-on
Mathurin to Bailey, no run on the stumps, tucked short to cover
Mathurin to Bailey, SIX runs tossed up, straight delivery, not much turn and Bailey launches the ball back over long-on, for a mighty maximum
Mathurin to Bailey, no run shorter, on the stumps, Bailey tries to pull again but can't get it away
Mathurin to Bailey, 2 runs sweeps from in front of the stumps to deep backward square leg
Mathurin to Bailey, 1 run flat, outside off, dabbed to short third man, the batsmen change their mind after starting to run and Bailey where's the throw on the back of his thigh
Mathurin to Warner, SIX runs drops short on the leg side, Warner smashes the ball up and over the deep square leg boundary like a man throwing a brick down a mineshaft
Sammy to Bailey, 1 run short and pulled to deep square leg
Sammy to Warner, FOUR runs back of a length on the off side to Warner and he punches a cut shot through the infield. Not a great start from Sammy
Sammy to Warner, 1 run Baugh up to the stumps, fuller length, crashed towards extra-cover on the drive where Pollard makes a diving stop
Sammy to Bailey, FOUR runs short and wide again, slapped dismissively through point for another boundary
Sammy to Bailey, no run length, tighter line outside off, Bailey goes back and guides the ball to short third man
Sammy to Bailey, 1 run on the stumps, doesn't really get up off a length, pulled flat towards deep backward square
Narine to Bailey, FOUR runs length, down the leg side and not much turn, helped on its way to the boundary by Bailey
Narine to Bailey, no run outside off, steered to short third man
Narine to Bailey, no run full, outside off, worked into the leg side
Narine to Bailey, 1 run flighted on the stumps, dug out to mid-on
Narine to Warner, SIX runs flatter delivery, carrom ball I think, on the stumps, dispatched far back over the bowler's head for another six!
Narine to Warner, FOUR runs width outside off and slashed hard through point
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run back of a length outside off, seaming in a touch, pulled through midwicket
Bravo to Warner, no run takes the pace off it, nurdled away on the off side
Bravo to Warner, 1 run pitched up on the legs, clipped to deep backward square
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run good length, not much room to work with it outside off, chopped down to third man
Bravo to Warner, 2 runs drifts down the leg side, punched off the pads and deep square leg has to come round to field
Bravo to Warner, 1 run full length, on the stumps, whipped away on the full to deep midwicket
Samuels to Warner, FOUR runs pitched up, in the slot and Warner smacks it back over deep midwicket. Ouch
Samuels to Warner, 1 run flatter, across Warner, nudged to cover

Samuels to Bailey, OUT a breakthrough from Samuels, as Bailey top-edges a sweep and deep square leg takes the catch running in from the boundary! Australia's captain (yep, the right one, this time) is caught with his fingers in the cookie jar and the tourists are two down
Samuels to Warner, no run quicker ball, almost a medium pace yorker, beats the batsman outside off
Samuels to Warner, no run length, not much turned, chopped to point who makes the save
Samuels to Warner, 1 run angled across and this time Warner gets a run to point
Bravo to Warner, no run pitched up, just outside off, driven into the ground and taken at extra-cover. The crowd get excited for a moment, but it was a bump ball
Bravo to Warner, no run slightly back of a length, rolls the fingers over it, blocked back to the bowler
Bravo to Warner, 2 runs tossed up, slower ball again, Warner waits and punches into the gap in front of deep midwicket and they steal two
Bravo to Warner, 1 run full, on the legs, glanced to short third man - he has a shy but misses as they scramble a single
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run slightly full, on off stump, driven through cover - Hussey is off the mark first ball
Bravo to Warner, 1 run pitched up, driven out to the fielder on the cover boundary
Samuels to Warner, 1 run on the stumps, dribbled down the ground to long-off
Samuels to Hussey, no run tossed up, deflected to short third man
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run top-edged as Hussey plays across the line ... but it falls short of long-on as he comes in off the rope. Lucky, Hussey, lucky
Samuels to Warner, 1 run flatter, pushed through outside off, dabbed to short third man
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run dropped short behind point and again they steal one
Samuels to Warner, 1 run slanted across, length ball, driven through the covers
Pollard to Warner, 1 run back of a length, outside the left-hander's leg stump, pulled away square
Pollard to Hussey, 2 runs on the body, clipped square on the leg side ... Pollard breaks the stumps at the non-striker's end when the throw comes in bit he didn't take it cleanly anway
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run length ball, played fine on the leg side
Pollard to Warner, no run fuller, on off and driven, fielded by mid-off
Pollard to Warner, 1 run back of a length, on leg stump, nudged round the corner for one - that's a well-paced fifty for Warner
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run full, on the stumps, punched through midwicket
Samuels to Hussey, SIX runs flat and straight, no need for Hussey to worry about the turn and he sweeps BIG over deep midwicket
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run outside off, drilled to the cover sweeper
Samuels to Warner, no run tight line across the batsman, played to cover
Samuels to Warner, 1 run flighted, driven down the ground for one
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run length outside off, played square through cover-point
Mathurin to Hussey, 1 run length, driven to long-off
Mathurin to Warner, SIX runs drops short and Warner bombastically hooks high over deep square leg. I think he's lost the ball ...
Mathurin to Wade, no run defended in front of the stumps
Mathurin to Wade, no run flatter delivery, nudged into the leg side
Mathurin to Wade, no run played off the batsman's legs, Mathurin fields himself and also hits the stumps - but Wade was just back
Narine to Hussey, 1 run on the stumps, turning across, played towards square leg off the pads
Narine to Wade, no run length, turning across, dabbed to point
Narine to Wade, FOUR runs tossed up, no real turn and Wade swings away across his front pad to the backward square boundary
Narine to Wade, no run turn and bounce off a length, beats the outside edge
Narine to Wade, 1 run on the stumps, goes back and nudges behind point
Narine to Hussey, no run outside off, comes forward and knocks into the off side
Edwards to Wade, 1 run back of a length, on the legs, Wade hops back and glances square
Edwards to Hussey, no run fast and straight, whipped from in front of the stumps to the man at midwicket
Edwards to Hussey, 1 wide well outside off and the batsman can't get anywhere near that
Edwards to Hussey, 1 run back of a length, outside off, swings and bottom edges past the stumps to short fine leg
Edwards to Wade, 1 run angled across, driven through the covers off a good length
Edwards to Hussey, 1 wide full and wide - Edwards thinks it was inside the return crease
Edwards to Hussey, no run rolls his fingers over it, edged on to the crease, Edwards cleans up off his own bowling to prevent a run

Edwards to Hussey, 2 runs is that a drop? I think it is ... It was a full-pitched delivery, Hussey tried to dig it out, got the toe of the bat on it, but Baugh couldn't hold on and the ball scooted away for four
Narine to Wade, SIX runs tossed up on middle and Wade clears his front foot out of the way and thumps the ball back over long-on
Narine to Wade, 1 run leg stump, flicked off the pads square of the wicket
Narine to Hussey, no run on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
Narine to Hussey, 1 run played off the pads to short fine leg, good work from the fielder and then Narine ensure the bails are broken at the non-striker's end ... but Hussey's bat was just in
Narine to Wade, 2 runs flighted on the stumps, driven with a flashing blade to extra-cover, who can't quite make the stop
Narine to Wade, no run on the stumps, chopped back down the wicket
Bravo to Hussey, FOUR runs pitched up and his first ball is lofted over extra-cover and away to the rope for four! Not the start his captain wanted
Bravo to Hussey, SIX runs good length, on the stumps, Hussey comes forward and whips a brutal aerial drive over long-on - that was clinical hitting
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run fuller length, on the stumps, driven to long-on
Bravo to Wade, no run full, on the stumps and a touch slower, Wade can't get his drive away
Bravo to Wade, no run rolls his fingers over it again, turning it into an offcutter - Wade swings and misses, with the ball swerving past off stump on its way through to the keeper
Bravo to Wade, 1 run length, again taking the pace off, clubbed down the ground
Samuels to Wade, no run full, flat and quick, beats Wade outside off stump
Samuels to Wade, no run pushed across the batsman, driven to cover
Samuels to Wade, no run flighted a bit more, turning across the batsman who misses with a big swing, Baugh removing the bails just in case

Samuels to Wade, OUT caught and bowled! It was basically a full toss and Wade smacked it straight back at Samuels, who anticipated the catch and took it comfortably moving to his right. But hold on, they're checking whether was a no-ball on height ... No, it was close but he's been given out
Samuels to Christian, 2 runs full, on the stumps, chipped down the ground wide of long-on and they take a couple
Samuels to Christian, 1 run length outside off, Christian plays a premeditated paddle shot to short fine leg
Edwards to McKay, no run length, quick and seaming back in, McKay prods tentatively but it's too good for him
Edwards to McKay, no run pitched up, steps back and makes another air shot
Edwards to McKay, SIX runs slings down a full toss on leg stump and McKay batters it down the ground for six! He gave that some humpty
Edwards to McKay, no run superb reply, a yorker wide of off stump, McKay had backed away and missed with a swish of the bat
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run full, swinging towards leg stump, shovelled to deep backward square and they scamper through for one

Bravo to McKay, no run slight change in pace, angled in from wide of the crease, McKay misses with a swipe as the ball sails past leg stump ... Baugh then hits the wicket but the batsman had grounded his bat
Bravo to McKay, 1 run length, on the stumps, dumped in front of midwicket for a single
Bravo to Doherty, 2 runs length ball, on the stumps, hooked out towards wide long-on, they come back for a couple but it's nowhere near enough - West Indies have won by 14 runs!
That's it from me - have a great weekend and do join us for the first Test, which starts on Saturday April 7. Bye!
West Indies won by 14 runs
Player of the match is Dwayne Smith, WI
